item.title: Destiny 2: Renegades Is About to Take Crossovers to the Next Level
item.description:
Summary

  • Destiny 2 has shifted from small to expansion-sized crossovers, as seen with the Star Wars-themed Renegades expansion.
  • The Renegades expansion introduces a significant crossover with a Star Wars theme, offering new armor sets and more.
  • Players may anticipate broader crossovers beyond Star Wars in Destiny 2's future with themes like Skyrim, Dead Space, and Cyberpunk 2077.

Destiny 2 's recent reveal livestream for the upcoming Edge of Fate expansion was a banger, chock-full of information about what it will be bringing to the base game when it launches on July 15. Bungie spent close to an hour going over the significant changes and new features that will be introduced with The Edge of Fate, with some of the highlights being the new planet Kepler, some planetary exploration and combat abilities, customizable difficulty options, and much more. However, while The Edge of Fate was meant to be the star of the show, Destiny 2 had a big surprise waiting near the end of the livestream that stole the spotlight.

With Destiny 2 's new direction seeing it launching two expansions each year, The Edge of Fate won't be alone in 2025. Towards the end of the expansions reveal livestream, Bungie gave fans a sneak peek at Destiny 2 's upcoming Renegades expansion, but it wasn't just the thrill of yet another expansion coming to the game this year that made it exciting. What really stood out about Renegades that The Edge of Fate didn't have is that it is a Star Wars -themed expansion, complete with lightsabers and themed armor sets. In light of the fact that it seems Destiny 2 has now moved from small-scale crossovers to expansion-sized crossovers, Renegades could set a precedent for the game's future.

Destiny 2: Renegades' Expansion-Level Crossover Could Set a Precedent

Destiny 2 Has Done Small-Scale Crossovers for Many Years

Destiny 2 has long done small-scale collaborations with other IPs, many of which have pulled players back into the game for a brief period. These crossovers are generally limited to ornament sets for armor, weapons, ships, Ghosts, and Sparrows, but they are enticing for fans of franchises beyond Destiny 2 .

  • PlayStation Franchises: These collaborations have included armor sets inspired by God of War , Horizon Zero Dawn , and Ghost of Tsushima .
  • Assassin's Creed : A crossover featuring themed armor ornaments and cosmetics.
  • Fortnite : Introduced skins and emotes inspired by Fortnite characters.
  • The Witcher : Geralt-inspired armor sets and related cosmetics.
  • Mass Effect : Armor ornaments themed after characters from the Mass Effect series.
  • Halo : As part of Bungie's 30th Anniversary, Destiny 2 featured weapons and armor inspired by the Halo franchise.

Destiny 2 even recently did a Star Wars crossover that featured relevant armor sets for each class, a Death Star-themed Ghost shell, a Star Wars -inspired Sparrow, a ship, emotes, and finishers. As it was with every crossover before it, these items were available for purchase through the Eververse store using Silver.

Destiny 2: Renegades Could Be a Sign That Crossovers Are Going Bigger

What is so unique about Destiny 2 's Renegades expansion is that it doesn't represent a small-scale crossover like those the game has done in the past. Instead, the entire expansion is themed after Star Wars , though the full extent of that, especially when it comes to the game's narrative and worldbuilding, is currently unknown. Based on the teaser trailer alone, it seems like Destiny 2 is bringing many elements of Star Wars into its world — not just cosmetics. However, it should be noted that what was shown in Destiny 2 's Renegades teaser trailer is subject to change.

According to Destiny 2 assistant game director Robbie Stevens, "Renegades takes the space western vibe and aesthetic that is Star Wars , and it puts it through that Destiny lens."

More or less, given how extensive Renegades' Star Wars crossover is, Destiny 2 players may be able to expect crossovers in the game on a much broader level than they've seen in the past. It appears that Destiny 2 is essentially taking the identity of Star Wars and putting a Destiny coat of paint on it, so it could easily do that with other IPs in the future. Perhaps fans will finally get those Skyrim , Dead Space , Doctor Who , and Cyberpunk 2077 crossovers they've been requesting for some time in the future, only in a much more transformative way.

item.title: Grand Theft Auto 6's Port Gellhorn Could Be a Playground For Troublemaking Gamers
item.description:
Rockstar recently dropped a new trailer for Grand Theft Auto 6 , full of new information and details that fans have been eagerly anticipating. The Grand Theft Auto 6 trailer was released without any warning, to the surprise of many, and the community has come alive with new theories and predictions based on what was shown.

The release of this new trailer has alleviated some of the pain that the community was feeling from the announcement of Grand Theft Auto 6 ’s delay, getting players accustomed to the new cast of characters and locations ahead of its 2026 release date. One of these destinations – Port Gellhorn – seems to be the ideal spot for players looking to cause trouble.

Port Gellhorn Could Facilitate Mayhem

Causing Covert Chaos

The Grand Theft Auto series is known for its varied landscapes, some of which have a luxurious exterior with a highly monitored criminal underbelly. Grand Theft Auto 6 ’s major areas mostly follow this rule, with areas varying from the vibrant Vice City to the biker-filled Ambrosia. The area that stands out is Port Gellhorn, known as Leonida’s forgotten coast.

This under-developed area of the map truly does seem forgotten, meaning players could seem almost invisible to the cops. For the types of players who like to wreak havoc and cause mayhem, Port Gellhorn may be the ideal place for maximum damage. If Grand Theft Auto 6 opts for unrealistic weapons, players may be able to use this zone as a testing ground while remaining completely undetected, avoiding rapid wanted level increases despite committing crimes.

What Can Players Expect From Port Gellhorn?

Port Gellhorn may be abandoned, but it isn’t devoid of life. From the information available, it appears that many different small communities have formed, some of which specializing in different types of criminal activity. It’s very likely that players will meet many diverse characters here throughout Grand Theft Auto 6 ’s story, with the possibility of some looking to cause mischief of their own.

The description of Port Gellhorn hints that it used to be bustling with tourists looking to see the now-defunct attractions. For the residents of Leonida, this wouldn’t be all too appealing anymore, but players may be able to turn these old attractions into opportunities for devastation, using them as equipment in their own personal playground. There is also the chance that some of these sites are run-down but still operational, providing added in-game entertainment in Grand Theft Auto 6 .

GTA Online Will Feel at Home in Port Gellhorn

With Grand Theft Auto 6 expected to get its own version of GTA Online like the previous game in the series, it wouldn’t be unexpected for Port Gellhorn to be a hub for troublemakers. Out of the way of the authorities, players could freely cause destruction, hunting down NPCs and players alike without the worry of being caught. There is a chance that players might need to be patient for Grand Theft Auto 6 ’s Online mode, but the story mode should offer them ample time to play around before connecting with other like-minded menaces online.

However, one leak shows promise for these reckless players. While nothing has been confirmed officially, there is some information which suggests that Grand Theft Auto 6 ’s Online mode may be available at launch, including a standalone version. Players who aren’t too interested in the story but are always looking to cause chaos may be in luck if this is true.

The Grand Theft Auto 6 trailer has many people in the community excited, and the details for each of these new locales will have many considering what kinds of activity each destination will let them get up to. While many players will want to take in the stunning vistas of Vice City and Leonida Keys, some may instead gravitate toward Port Gellhorn to be carefree and careless.

item.title: 'I Might Eventually Make a Stardew Valley 2' ConcernedApe Talks Potential Sequel
item.description:
Summary

  • ConcernedApe may create Stardew Valley 2 in the future.
  • ConcernedApe said that a Stardew Valley sequel is possible while appearing on the TigerBelly podcast.
  • Currently, ConcernedApe is working on Haunted Chocolatier.

Eric "ConcernedApe" Barone has said that he might one day make Stardew Valley 2 . The original Stardew Valley is one of the most popular video games of all time and maintains a massive community of players nine years after its initial launch. Creator ConcernedApe has released all kinds of exciting new updates for Stardew Valley over the years, which has kept fans satisfied in the absence of a Stardew Valley 2 .

Stardew Valley updates have added significant new content to the life sim/RPG, giving players new areas to explore, new scenes to experience, and new characters to meet. ConcernedApe has said in the past that there may never be an end to Stardew Valley updates, but it seems as though he's also open to one day making a proper Stardew Valley 2 .

ConcernedApe recently appeared on the TigerBelly podcast with Bobby Lee, where Lee asked about a potential Stardew Valley 2 and the ongoing updates to the original game. "I might eventually make a Stardew Valley 2 , to be honest," ConcernedApe said. Lee then asked why ConcernedApe doesn't charge for Stardew Valley updates, to which he said, "I just don't care that much about money." ConcernedApe clarified that money has never been the "driving motivating factor" of making Stardew Valley . "What I care about is people loving the game."

Stardew Valley 2 Could Happen One Day

If Stardew Valley 2 ever happens, one has to imagine that it will be an instant success. The original Stardew Valley sold over 41 millions of copies, earned rave reviews from critics, and quite simply, has become one of the most beloved video games of all time. Considering this, Stardew Valley 2 would almost assuredly bring those millions of fans back for the new game while also drawing in potential newcomers to the franchise.

"What I care about is people loving the game."

Time will tell if a Stardew Valley 2 ever materializes, but ConcernedApe fans have a different project to look forward to in the meantime. ConcernedApe's Haunted Chocolatier is in active development and is expected to release at some point within the next five years. For the uninitiated, Haunted Chocolatier has players run a chocolate store and interact with a variety of humans and ghosts. Based on what's been shown so far, Haunted Chocolatier will have more action than Stardew Valley , but it will still maintain the latter game's cozy vibes and general aesthetic. Here's hoping more information on Haunted Chocolatier comes sooner rather than later.

item.title: Another Batch of Nintendo Switch 2 Pre-Orders Have Sold Out Almost Instantly
item.description:
Summary

  • Switch 2 pre-orders sold out in 10 minutes on the UK My Nintendo Store.
  • UK pre-orders were open to all paid and current Nintendo Switch Online subscribers.
  • US subscribers will receive email invites from May 8 for Switch 2 pre-orders.

Early on May 7, a wave of Nintendo Switch 2 console pre-orders went live via the My Nintendo Store in the UK, but the new allotment sold out within 10 minutes of going live. The Switch 2 pre-order window was open to all paid and current Nintendo Switch Online subscribers in the UK, with no lotteries or additional requirements.

Following the April 2 Nintendo Direct focused on the Switch 2, pre-orders of the highly anticipated console started at different intervals across the globe. Although pre-orders in the US and Canada were pushed back to April 24 due to concerns around the Trump administration's global tariffs, retailers in countries like the UK and Australia started taking pre-orders a few days after the Nintendo Direct aired. Despite Nintendo's ongoing efforts to ramp up production, Switch 2 pre-orders have been a chaotic experience for many users globally. The Switch 2 and its accessories will be fully released on June 5.

Although the My Nintendo Store has been touted as a straightforward way for Nintendo Switch Online subscribers to purchase a Switch 2 ahead of June 5, some of the storefront's console allotment quickly sold out. As reported by Nintendo Life, Switch 2 pre-orders of the base console and the Mario Kart World bundle via the My Nintendo Store in the UK sold out within 10 minutes of the window opening.

My Nintendo Store Pre-Orders Of The Switch 2 Quickly Sold Out

  • Switch 2 pre-orders via the UK My Nintendo Store sold out within 10 minutes.
  • The pre-order window was exclusive to all UK-based Nintendo Switch Online subscribers.
  • No email invitations were necessary to participate in the pre-order.
  • Both the base Switch 2 console and the Mario Kart World bundle were available.

The offer was publicly open to all paid and current Nintendo Switch Online subscribers in the UK, with no additional requirements and no invitations needed. However, the Nintendo Switch Online requirement was implemented to give customers a shot at getting a Switch 2 pre-ordered while simultaneously deterring scalpers.

By comparison, qualified Nintendo Switch Online subscribers in the US will receive emails starting May 8 to pre-order Switch 2 consoles and accessories via the My Nintendo Store. Users who get an email from the My Nintendo Store will have 72 hours to complete their purchase. Once all email waves have been sent out, pre-orders via the My Nintendo Store will open to the public. Retailers like Walmart have instead opted to promote their launch day stock online and in person, rather than take additional Switch 2 pre-orders.

With new features like GameChat and games like Mario Kart World , the Switch 2 is expected to sell out quickly upon release. It is currently unknown when the next allotments of Switch 2 pre-orders in the UK will be available via the My Nintendo Store or other retailers, so users must keep track or wait until June 5.

item.title: Destiny 2: All Rite of the Nine Rewards & How to Get Them
item.description:
The Light vs Darkness story arc may be over, but Destiny 2 is far from done. The Fate Saga will last for several years, and Rite of the Nine serves as a prologue for the first expansion in this new story arc. The Nine have always been a mysterious group in Destiny lore, but it seems like players will get to learn a lot more about them over the next couple of years. Before The Edge of Fate comes out, players will have an opportunity to get some Nine-themed weapons as part of this limited-time event, along with a few cosmetics.

All Rite of the Nine Weapons in Destiny 2

There are 12 weapons in total that can be earned during Rite of the Nine. All 12 are reprised weapons from Prophecy, Spire of the Watcher, and Ghosts of the Deep. The weapons are as follows:

Weapon Name

Dungeon it Drops From

New Pacific Epitaph

Ghosts of the Deep

Judgement

Prophecy

Relentless

Prophecy

Liminal Vigil

Spire of the Watcher

Prosecutor

Prophecy

Greasy Luck

Ghosts of the Deep

Wilderflight

Spire of the Watcher

Long Arm

Spire of the Watcher

A Sudden Death

Prophecy

No Survivors

Ghosts of the Deep

Terminus Horizon

Spire of the Watcher

Cold Comfort

Ghosts of the Deep

Not only do these weapons have a unique new appearance, but they also have a new Origin Trait that you can choose called Gravity Well. This Origin Trait causes your weapon to pull ammo toward you whenever you reload.

There are also three different versions of each weapon. There is the normal version, the Adept version, and the Adept version with a shiny visual effect. Weapons drop from the dungeons, but you can also obtain them from the chest next to the Emissary of the Nine. Each time you open the chest, it will cost 250 Nonary Manifold. Nonary Manifold can be obtained in Rite of the Nine dungeons and also from completing bounties.

At the social space for this event, you can attune to one of the twelve weapons to increase your chances of obtaining it. This also includes weapons you get from the chest.

Make sure you only attune to weapons that are available to the currently active dungeon. If you try to attune to a weapon that is available in Prophecy while Spire of the Watcher is the active dungeon, you will not benefit from the attunement. Only weapons from the currently active dungeon will drop from the chest, so be careful to avoid wasting your Nonary Manifold.

All Cosmetic Rewards in Rite of the Nine

Weapons are not the only thing you can obtain in Rite of the Nine. There are several cosmetics that you can get as well. For each dungeon, there is an emblem you can obtain if you get a gold rating on each encounter. You can also get an emblem for completing all weapon quests.

Finally, there is a new title/seal you can obtain called ETERNAL. This title is unlocked by completing all Triumphs associated with the seal, and if you pull this off, you get a shader called Astrograph.
